summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to The Mar-a-Lago Club in Palm Beach, Florida. It commands the club to appear and produce employment records for a witness in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, with an appearance date set for November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)), which is the subject of this subpoena.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, issuing the command to The Mar-a-Lago Club.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for Mar-a-Lago Records
events.description: The Mar-a-Lago Club is commanded to appear before the U.S. District Court in New York to testify and produce employment records related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: The Mar-a-Lago Club, 1100 South Ocean Boulevard, Palm Beach, Florida 33480
United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, 40 Foley Square, Manhattan, New York, New York
keyFacts: A federal subpoena was issued to The Mar-a-Lago Club in October 2021, demanding employment records for the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.
The subpoena requires the club to appear in court on November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m. in New York City.
The document is part of the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (docket number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
Failure to comply with the subpoena constitutes contempt of court and subjects the recipient to civil and criminal penalties.
The subpoena was signed by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss on behalf of the Southern District of New York.
